clinical_study.brief_title: AdheRence to Inhaled Corticosteroids in Asthma
clinical_study.official_title: AdheRence to Inhaled Corticosteroids in Asthma

brief_summary.textblock: It is widely recognized that asthma in adult African American patients is a significant health problem, which is partly affected by relatively low inhaled corticosteroid (ICS) adherence rates. The goal of this study is to pilot test an ICS adherence intervention, ARICA, that aims to improve ICS adherence in adult African Americans.

detailed_description.textblock: The investigators will evaluate ARICA in Duke primary care clinics to study its feasibility and acceptability using a quasi-experimental pre-post study design. The study will enroll between 32 and 48 adult African Americans with persistent asthma and suboptimal ICS adherence, and their health care providers, to study the use of the intervention and key indicators of the intervention's potential effectiveness.

primary_outcome.measure: Participant experiences with and perceptions of the ARICA program
primary_outcome.description: Assessment of participants experiences with and perceptions of the ARICA program, as assessed by in-depth semi-structured qualitative interview

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in patient reported medication adherence as measured by the Voils Adherence Questionnaire
Change in Asthma Knowledge as measured by by the Knowledge, Attitudes, Self-Efficacy Asthma Questionnaire
Change in patient-reported asthma medication attitudes as measured by the Knowledge, Attitudes, Self-Efficacy Asthma Questionnaire
Change in Patient-Reported Asthma Self-Efficacy as measured by the Knowledge, Attitudes, Self-Efficacy Asthma Questionnaire
Change in Asthma Control as measured by the Asthma Control Test
Change in Asthma-Related Quality of Life as measured by the Marks Asthma-Related Quality of Life Questionnaire
Change in Patient-Provider Communication as measured by the Interpersonal Process of Care Survey- Communication domain

arm_group.description: This group is considered the control group. This group will have scheduled texts and emails for the monthly surveys after the participant completes the baseline questionnaires.

This group is considered the intervention group. Participants in this group will receive weekly texts and emails containing asthma facts and myths. They will also complete monthly surveys and participate in asthma education sessions.

intervention.description: Personalized ARICA (AdheRence to Inhaled Corticosteroids in Asthma) intervention package.
